intro: Enchysia scapigera, commonly known as the scarlet flax or red flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are small and white to pink in color. Enchysia scapigera is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid environments.
